answers.answer: Hi there.  Okay, I'm not going to lie . . .   19 pounds by 11 weeks is probably considered a big weight gain.  Has your doctor talked to you about this? Just curious.

Yes she has an they have not said anything about it. An I'm worried about it because that much scares me. An the fact that my Dr has not really said anything about it does not help put my mind at rest.
Eat healthier, or try to. Just watch your intake and keep track of ur wieght. Good luck! (:

That really is a lot and I would say more than normal.  Are you eating a lot more?  I did gain a lot of weight with my pregnancies but I was underweight to begin with.  But the weight went on much more toward the middle to end.  You've got a long way to go.  Some women gain 20 pounds there ENTIRE pregnancy!  Has your diet changed?  You do eat a bit more when pregnant but we have to make sure it isn't over the top and that we are eating healthy things.  :)
I'm not eating more or any different from before I got pregnant. I asked my mom (I'm her first kid of 3) how big she got with me an she said she put on a lot

Were you underweight or average before you got pregnant?I was a bit overweight and my doc has been on my case since day one tracking my weight gain. I don't have high blood pressure or diabetes, but she only wanted me to gain 20 lbs in my entire pregancy. So far I've gained 22 and I'm barely 36+1, to which she is not too happy about. If your doc is not showing concern you should still try and limit yourself a bit because too much weight gain can bring complications and it can also bring gestational diabetes! God bless you and Best of luck!
I'm 20 weeks and I've officially gained 5 pounds but that is alot of weight gain has your appetite dramatically increased?

Honey don't even worry if your diet hasn't changed and you are eating healthy you are okay. I gained 90 pounds during my pregnancy I'm now 4 months postpartum and have 20 pounds left to loose until I'm my prepregnancy weight. I did develop preeclempsia but that's because I had a very large baby she's in the 97th percentile right now for height and weight she's wearing 9-12 month clothes at almost 4 months lol. And yes I am exclusively breastfeeding

Btw we are both very healthy and I never ate junk food or sweets during pregnancy! ! Quit worrying about weight everyone is different :) it irritates me seeing or hearing when people say gain only 30 lbs max or it'll be so hard to loose afterwards like oh please this weight is melting off of me like butter lol girl don't even worry

I would ask your doctor about it.  I don't think we can really tell you to worry or not worry.  There are always health implications to being significantly overweight.  Sounds like you are eating the same and healthy but still have this weight gain.  Makes me wonder about your metabolic system.  So, talk to your doctor.also, . . .   just a thought.  Have you had an ultrasound yet?  Just one baby in there . . .???

That doesnt make any since to me though, if u haven't changed eating habits and nothing has changed how are u exclusively gaining wieght? Unless it's genetic.Did u happen to wiegh yourself before you got pregnant or gained wieght? And im just giving my opinion, no offence at all.

question: Okay so I'm only 11weeks an I've put on 19 pounds I keep getting asked if I'm having twins an I'm not. So my question is has anyone else started showing early?
title: im so big.
